p: Encephalopathy is a change in the mental state of a patient characterized by an altered level of consciousness, and may refer to anything on the continuum from lethargy to coma, with alterations in the behavior or personality [ 4, 5, 9]. It is the result of diffuse cortical involvement [ 4]. A new-onset psychosis is more likely associated with an autoimmune encephalitis than with a viral infection [ 7].
